meanings.definition: A level of skill or proficiency in a particular activity or field.
meanings.sent1: His dan in painting allowed him to create beautiful artworks.
meanings.sent2: She reached a high dan in playing the piano after years of practice.
meanings.sent3: Even though he was just a beginner, his dan in cooking impressed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her dan in photography shone brightly among the other artists.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's dan in ballet was evident in every graceful movement.

meanings.definition: A traditional Japanese form of poetry consisting of three lines with a syllable pattern of 5-7-5.
meanings.sent1: In class, they learned how to write a dan with the correct syllable count.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed composing dans that captured the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a dan made everyone laugh with its unexpected humor.
meanings.sent4: The dan she wrote about the sunset painted a vivid picture in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The poet's dan about the cherry blossoms was filled with delicate imagery.

meanings.definition: A title of respect used before a man's name in Malaysia and Indonesia.
meanings.sent1: The elder was addressed with the title dan out of respect.
meanings.sent2: Dan is a common honorific used in their culture.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly referred to himself as 'Dan' to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: The title dan added a touch of formality to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: When he introduced himself as 'Dan', everyone knew he was highly regarded.
